From: "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@...>




* Iron Raptor breathed hard as the broad dome continued to expand, feeling
the energy from the sword begin to weaken and flutter.
It was a great weapon, but this size of power was too draining. If she
continued to transfer power into the dome from the sword she would soon be
running off her own power supply and now from what energy she had managed to
collect from the charges.
Sweat was collecting on her brow and the hair, which formed her bangs, were
stringy and wet against it, hearing her own breathing rasping from inside
the helm.
The battle rage which controlled her movements wasn�t gone and it wouldn�t
be for a while, but soon her energy would be what was powering this dome and
she was sure that she wouldn�t be able to do it.
After all, this body was made for speed and swiftness, not brut strength.
But she had seen just what damage this new weapon had caused, and she would
have whistled with impressment if she would have had any breath to spare.
But watching Nemisis Enforcer try to protect himself in his beast mode, then
fail and fall to earth was all the satisfaction she needed.
If only�if only she could do that again, then maybe she could get him on the
ground or maybe into stasis lock. Then she could move onto another foe,
maybe take out a couple more.
But it would take her up to 20 min to get everything back again, up to a
workable level�as well as more then a few charges against her shield.
But Iron Raptor almost caught herself laughing as she looked at Nemisis
after he had dropped to ground. His wings all charred and sizzling. It was
rather funny. He had looked like a fly, which had ran into an electric
fence!
Buts she snickered to herself instead.
She had watched Nemisis Enforcer launch himself into the air but knew that
he was badly hurt, simply smiling as he called her a witch. *

� Have no better names for me, Nemisis?�

* She said to herself from inside of her helm, her faceplate warm from her
breath against the metal from the past few moments.
Iron Raptor stood ready with her sword in hand again, but the dome had long
since disappeared and blade was only now dimming to the image of normal
alloy again. Now the air around her and probably Nemisis had more of a
static feeling to it, like there had just been a lightning strike and the
air still sizzled with the heat of it.
She had no idea what surprise this body would pull out of it�s hat now, but
she was sure that it would do some damage�but since most of her energy had
been in the dome, she doubted that it would be anything spectacular.

Her scanners swept the surrounding area, taking in the remaining signatures
of Maximal and Alliance bots, her mind turning to Prowl after she had
received his thoughts. *
< Are you alright, Prowl? >
* She sent, her mind slightly worried about him. But he couldn�t be
dead�because she would be dead too.
It was supposedly, part of their link and the deal he had made with the
Matrix.
There was one thing that she had failed to notice, however�was what weapon
Scattershot was throwing towards her. And she didn�t know just what it was
until it was much too late.
Iron Raptor had just enough time to turn her eyes towards Scattershot, not
even enough for her head to follow, before a charge suddenly struck her side
in a wide and heavy explosion..
The impact threw her 10feet from where she had been standing last, armor
still flying away from where she had been his as she fell hard against her
shoulder.
Her arm slid under her side as the momentum carried her body over so that
she ended up on her back, her cape sprawled out under her and her helm
retracted. Her hair also sprawled out under her, her arms out at either side
of her while her legs were drawn together.
A gaping wound in her side, plating from her side, along it and then over
half her stomach, as well as armor from her hip missing. But it was only her
side which was bleeding, blue skin spattered with mech-fluid showing in the
remaining areas armor was missing.

She could feel it, the circuits and wires which were broken or twisted
inside of the hole, and the ribs which were cracked or snapped deeper
inside.
There was little wreckage in too deeper then that, but it hurt like an SOB.
Iron Raptor breather out a heavy sigh and opened her eyes, looking up at the
sky dotted with smoke from exploding charges and the ringing in her ears of
the gun blasts and battle cries. Stunned and not moving from where she lay.
Nemisis was still in the air but she couldn�t see or hear him, and
Scattershot was still out there.
She knew that she had to get up, she couldn�t fall from just a wound to the
side. She had suffered worse from past battles.
But then she remembered something�she had been more armored then, and now
she had sensitive skin/armor now and she would feel every damage she took.
Iron Raptor sighed enough, but if this wound stayed like this, open and
bleeding, then she would lose energy and maybe even pass out from loss of
mech-fluid. She had to heal, but she couldn�t just run inside and use a CR
chamber.
She closed her eyes, trying to shut out the weapons and voices, but it was
no use. But what she was doing was trying to find a repair program or
something like that, and she needed to be still for something like that.
Going through the programs and files which were new to her and obviously
came with this new body.
What she would give for an instruction manual!
While doing this, Iron Raptor had not noticed the Maximal gestalt, which had
appeared on the field, mistaking it�s rumbling footsteps for that of
Oblitercon. *
